reason: Specification is semantically complete with clear goals, success criteria, and edge case handling.

evidence.citation: Implement JWT-based authentication system with refresh token rotation, supporting login, logout, and token refresh endpoints. Success measured by: all endpoints return correct status codes, tokens expire as configured, refresh rotation prevents reuse attacks.
User can log in with email/password, receive access token (15min TTL) and refresh token (7d TTL), use refresh token to get new access token, log out to invalidate all tokens.

evidence.claim: Edge cases and error paths addressed
evidence.citation: Error handling: invalid credentials (401), expired tokens (401), missing tokens (403), token reuse (403 + revoke), rate limiting (429), server errors (500).
Depends on: existing user model (users table), bcrypt for hashing, jsonwebtoken library, redis for token blacklist. All dependencies listed in contracts.md.
Migration: Add `refresh_token_version` column to users table. Rollback: Drop column, remove auth endpoints from routes. No breaking changes to existing API.
